p: SEM micrographs revealed three types of glandular trichomes: Peltate, capitate type 1 (C1), and type 2 (C2) ( Figure 2). Peltate trichomes were present in all studied species and all plant parts, the only difference between the samples was in the number of these trichomes on a particular plant part. In most samples, peltate trichomes were more numerous in the flower region (slightly more numerous on calyces) and less numerous on both sides of leaves and stems ( Table 1, Figure 3 and Figure 4). The size of these trichomes was an average of 74 ± 9 μm in all studied samples.
